item.title: Setting up NFS in OpenStep
item.description:
If your server or host PC supports NFS, you can set up shared directories for OpenStep. For example, if the shared folder is nfs://192.168.1.19/nfs/ftp, you can add the imported directory in NFSManager.app as follows:
Run mount command in OpenStep to mount a remote directory as follows:``` $ mount -t 192.168.8.16:/mnt/openstep /coreonion * [https://www.cyberciti.biz/faq/apple-mac-osx-nfs-mount-command-tutorial/](https://www.cyberciti.biz/faq/apple-mac-osx-nfs-mount-command-tutorial/) * [http://nextstep.onionmixer.net/wordpress/?p=139](http://nextstep.onionmixer.net/wordpress/?p=139)
